muTel.daqplotlib.config package

Submodules

muTel.daqplotlib.config.Config module

class muTel.daqplotlib.config.Config.Config(cfg: dict[str])

Bases: object

This is a wrapper for a dict whose values may be accessed as if the keys were also attributes.

Note

Items in cfg may also be accessed as Config.<key> or Config[<key>] or using the method get(<key>).

Take in mind this has been achieved adding some syntactic sugar to the built-in methods __getitem__ and __getattr__, this last one being called only if __getattribute__ fails.

Examples

>>> foo = {'a' : 1, 'b' : 2}
>>> bar = Config(foo)
>>> print(bar.a)
1
>>> print(bar['b'])
2
>>> print(bar.get('c'))
None
>>> print(bar.get('c', default=3))
3
property cfg: dict[str]

Get the dictionary used in the instance construction.

get(key, default=None)

Gets an the value of key with default as default. Wrapper for cfg.get.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – Key of the item in cfg.

  • default (Any, optional) – Default value that will be returned in case key doesn’t exist.

Returns:

value – Value corresponding to the item with key as key or default in case key doesn’t exist in cfg.

Return type:

Any

keys()

Get cfg.keys().

values()

Get cfg.values().

class muTel.daqplotlib.config.Config.FieldConfig(name: str, cfg: dict[str])

Bases: Config

A subclass of Config. This represents the configuration for a field or column of data.

Notes

The supported keys are: - bins : int - range : [float, float] - label : str - log : bool These keys will be used by the plot method in muTel.daqplotlib.Plot (and its subclasses) to style the plots and compute some internal variables.

property name: str

Get the name of the field (or data column).

class muTel.daqplotlib.config.Config.PlotConfig(cfg: dict[str, dict[str]])

Bases: Config

This class represents the configuration for a muTel.daqplotlib.plots.Plot (and its subclasses). Its a subclass of Config where each item in the cfg attribute is a FieldConfig instance.

classmethod from_yaml(path: str | Path = 'default') → PlotConfig

Class method to build an instance from a .yaml file in the path given. It first checks the path given and in case this fails, it will check the default directory using the default cfg directory (config_directory) defined in muTel.utils.paths``as ``<config_directory>/daq.

Parameters:

path (str or pathlib.Path, default ‘default’) – Path to the .yaml file with the configuration.

Returns:

plot_cfg – The PlotConfig instance built from the dictionary in .yaml format.

Return type:

PlotConfig

Module contents

Plotting Configuration

The main class is PlotConfig, which allows reading from a .yaml file. It also defines the Config class, which is a wrapper for a dictionary so that its items may be accessed as attributes and returns a default value.

Config

Config

Class implementing a dictionary with items that can be accessed as attributes

FieldConfig

Subclass of Config that represents the configuration for a variable (field).

PlotConfig
Subclass of Config where each value is a FieldConfig

instance
